intro: Spergularia salsuginea var. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. This variety is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
